rev.comment: rm 'criticism' main section; there is already a section in [[History of Google]] dealing with criticism.

Line 98: Line 98:
Additionally, Google has also recently formed a partnership with [[Sun Microsystems]] to help share and distribute each other's technologies. As part of the partnership Google will hire employees to help the [[open source]] office program [[OpenOffice.org]].<ref>Brown, James. "[http://www.vnunet.com/computing/news/2143242/sun-partners-google Sun partners with Google]." ''vnunet.com.'' [[October 5]], [[2005]].</ref>
Additionally, Google has also recently formed a partnership with [[Sun Microsystems]] to help share and distribute each other's technologies. As part of the partnership Google will hire employees to help the [[open source]] office program [[OpenOffice.org]].<ref>Brown, James. "[http://www.vnunet.com/computing/news/2143242/sun-partners-google Sun partners with Google]." ''vnunet.com.'' [[October 5]], [[2005]].</ref>
â
==Criticism==
  â
The company's privacy practices have been heavily criticized by some; see [[Google Watch]], [[Google and privacy issues]].
  â
This has been accompanied by [[Google censorship]].
  â   â
Additionally, [[conspiracy theory|conspiracy theorists]] allege that Google's stated goal of "organizing the world's information" is a [[euphemism]] for its [[hidden agenda]] of [[world domination]]. See also [[Google OS]]/[[GooOS]][http://www.kottke.org/04/04/google-operating-system], [[List of acquisitions by Google]], [[Current TV]]'s [[Google Current]].
  â   â
The methods used by [[Google search]] to rank pages' importance, known as [[PageRank]], has often been criticized; see [[TrustRank]], [[Google bomb]], [[miserable failure]].
  â   â
Google has run into trouble with [[copyright infringement]] on several occasions. Two prominent examples are the case of [[Google X]], which [[Apple Computer]] sued over, and [[Gmail]], which was renamed "Google Mail" in the UK and Germany.
